name: Kepler-155
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-155 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-155 is a star with 0.5199999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.62 times its radius. It is located 965.39 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-155 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-155 b

Kepler-155 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.93 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-155.

The mass of Kepler-155 b is 5.61 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-155 b is 2.09 that of Earth. At 5.61 Earth masses, Kepler-155 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-155 c

Kepler-155 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.24 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 52.66 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-155.

The mass of Kepler-155 c is 6.68 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-155 c is 2.24 that of Earth. At 6.68 Earth masses, Kepler-155 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

With a semi-major axis of 0.242 astronomical units, and a mass of 6.68 Earth masses, Kepler-155 c could, potentially, be a habitable planet with stable bodies of liquid water on its surface, like Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-155, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
